skill.name: woocommerce-markdown
skill.description: Guidelines for creating and modifying markdown files in WooCommerce. Use when writing documentation, README files, or any markdown content.

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and guidelines for markdown formatting. It has no executable code, network access, or file system operations beyond reading its own documentation file. The content is purely instructional with no security risks.

content.value_statement: WooCommerce documentation requires specific markdown formatting standards. This skill ensures your markdown files follow WooCommerce's linting rules and style guidelines.
actual_capabilities: Validates heading styles, list formatting, and code blocks
Provides markdown error fixes and troubleshooting
Ensures UTF-8 encoding for special characters
Validates CLAUDE.md files for AI parsing
limitations: Only applies to WooCommerce project markdown files
Requires markdownlint to be installed locally
Must run from WooCommerce repository root directory
Cannot auto-fix all markdown issues manually

use_cases.title: Document new features properly

use_cases.title: Format documentation consistently
use_cases.description: Ensure all markdown files follow WooCommerce's style guide and pass linting

best_practices: Always run markdownlint from the WooCommerce repository root to load proper configuration
Use markdownlint --fix first to auto-correct most formatting issues
Specify language for all code blocks to improve readability and syntax highlighting
Use UTF-8 box-drawing characters for directory tree structures
anti_patterns: Don't use ASCII art (+--, |--) for directory trees - use UTF-8 characters instead
Never skip heading levels (H1 ‚Üí H3) - maintain proper hierarchy
Avoid using emphasis (bold/italic) as headings - use proper heading tags
Don't use tabs or inconsistent spacing for list indentation

faq.question: Why must I run markdownlint from the repository root?
faq.answer: The WooCommerce project has a .markdownlint.json configuration file in the root that defines custom rules. Running from root ensures these rules are applied.

faq.question: What if markdownlint --fix doesn't solve all issues?
faq.answer: Some issues like missing language specifications for code blocks require manual fixes. The linter will indicate what needs manual attention.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for non-WooCommerce markdown files?
faq.answer: The guidelines are specific to WooCommerce's configuration. Other projects may have different markdownlint rules and standards.

faq.question: How do I handle UTF-8 encoding issues?
faq.answer: Use the provided tr command to remove control characters, or ensure your editor saves files in UTF-8 format without BOM.

faq.question: What's the difference between MD031 and MD032 errors?
faq.answer: MD031 requires blank lines around code blocks, while MD032 requires blank lines around lists. Both ensure proper spacing.

faq.question: Are tabs allowed in WooCommerce markdown?
faq.answer: Yes, unlike standard markdownlint rules, WooCommerce allows hard tabs in markdown files as configured in their settings.
